lastMessage.data: Finally, on a fun note in the UK, the Head Chef of Buckingham Palace has also requested to meet us in early November to discuss Eko being used internally there (this client introduction was done via one of our Food Service industry partners). No word yet if the Queen will be in attendance for the demo thoughâ€¦she'd probably end up wanting her own custom sticker pack to order people around!  (maybe that's just me though ðŸ˜ƒ)

Hi all ðŸ‘‹,

We just had a long 2.5 hr conversation with AirAsiaâ€™s Head of Brand & Culture, Attila, to talk about the AirAsia deployment. As you guys know, AirAsia launched last Friday, so this was our first official feedback session.

So far the response from employees on the ground has been overwhelmingly positive. In just 3 working days we now have 11,163 new Eko accounts, and AirAsia is now by far the largest deployment in Malaysia, increasing the activity in the region by 650%.

They LOVED the fact that our product is chat focused. One thing they are using frequently is sending Thumbs Up within the chat to commend their coworkers. This was something that their previous product, Facebook Workplace, does not do nearly as well, as the chat functionality of that product was not powerful enough in an enterprise setting. For a company as focused on culture as AirAsia, you can see why this is something their employees really enjoy using. Now they are thinking about tying in an employee reward program to our Thumbs Up.

The other feature that has gotten a significant amount of traction is Discover. Discover has always been designed as a way to help drive organic engagement with the company from the ground level, meaning that it is mainly driven by the employees instead of from the top down management team. AirAsiaâ€™s culture aligns with this vision very well, and their staff really enjoyed the ability to have meaningful conversation with the entire company via Discoverâ€™s posts and ranking system.

Lastly, the feature that ties everything together for this customer is Portal. Portal allows Eko to become a centralized source of truth for ALL enterprise products within a company. AirAsia has made Portal the official way to access every single piece of software that they use. This means every staff has to use Eko Portal to access other products like Facebook Workplace, Workday, Oracle, and any other piece of software they use internally. Everything is connected via Google SSO so the integration is seamless. Now, an employee only need to remember one piece of software, Eko, in order to work at AirAsia. This is really important for engagement as software fatigue is one of the biggest issues in enterprise right now, employees do not want to remember or use 10 different pieces of software for work, and having everything tied into Eko Portal elegantly solves this problem for their staff.

Currently there are 36 different apps setup on their Portal, but I expect the number to keep going up overtime as we include more of their employee base. 

AirAsia has now officially shut down their internal intranet website, it is now all redirected to Eko. This means all employee bookmarks and search engine results are all redirected to our product.

One last thing, all these engagement is from a simple all company broadcast and internal intranet redirect. There will be more official launch events coming up, where we will work with their team to help push the product to all their branch offices. 

We are still on the tip of the iceberg in terms of potential engagement. As a company, AirAsia have ~25,000 staff, and sends 40,000 emails and 80,000 chat messages per day. I expect us to go beyond that if we execute everything right. Lots more excitement to come!
Swag McSwagger create this task to Kiattirat (Fang) Sujjapongse.
